categorization_fixes.name: Audeze LCD-XC
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Audeze LCD-XC is a closed-back planar magnetic over-ear headphone, not an IEM. It features 106mm planar drivers and weighs 677g, which are typical specifications for full-sized headphones.

categorization_fixes.name: Audeze Euclid
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Audeze Euclid is correctly categorized as an IEM. It features an 18mm planar magnetic driver designed for in-ear use with MMCX cable and multiple ear tip options. This is Audeze's first closed-back planar IEM.

categorization_fixes.name: A&K T8iE
categorization_fixes.reasoning: A&K T8iE is correctly categorized as an IEM. It's a collaboration between Astell & Kern and Beyerdynamic featuring Tesla technology in a single dynamic driver in-ear design.

categorization_fixes.name: Audiosense DT200
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Audiosense DT200 is correctly categorized as an IEM. Features 2 Knowles balanced armature drivers with detachable MMCX cable, typical IEM design.

categorization_fixes.name: Audiosense DT600
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Audiosense DT600 is correctly categorized as an IEM. Features 6 Knowles balanced armature drivers with MMCX connector, designed for in-ear use.

categorization_fixes.name: Hifiman HE500
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Hifiman HE500 is a planar magnetic over-ear headphone, not an IEM. It weighs 502g and features full-sized over-the-ear design that completely encloses the ears. This is one of HiFiMAN's classic planar magnetic headphones.

categorization_fixes.name: Meze Rai Penta
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Meze Rai Penta is correctly categorized as an IEM. Features 4 balanced armature + 1 dynamic driver in a hybrid configuration with MMCX connector for in-ear use.

categorization_fixes.name: BLON B20
categorization_fixes.reasoning: BLON B20 is correctly categorized as cans. It's a full-size planar magnetic over-ear headphone with 97x76mm drivers, weighing 460g. Open-back design with wood and metal construction.

categorization_fixes.name: Final D8000 Pro
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Final D8000 Pro is correctly categorized as cans. It's a semi-open back planar magnetic over-ear headphone featuring AFDS planar magnetic driver technology, weighing 523g.

categorization_fixes.name: Moondrop Para
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Moondrop Para is correctly categorized as cans. It's a full-size planar magnetic over-ear headphone with ultra-large 100mm diameter diaphragm, weighing 530g.

categorization_fixes.name: Moondrop Void
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Moondrop Void is correctly categorized as cans. It's a full-sized open-back dynamic headphone with 50mm driver, weighing approximately 250g. This is Moondrop's first full-sized headphone model.

categorization_fixes.name: Stax SR-Lambda Pro
categorization_fixes.reasoning: Stax SR-Lambda Pro is correctly categorized as cans. It's a circumaural electrostatic over-ear headphone featuring push-pull electrostatic drivers with 2-micrometer thick diaphragms.

categorization_fixes.name: Symphonium HarmonicDyne Helios
categorization_fixes.reasoning: This entry appears to be the HarmonicDyne Helios (not Symphonium Helios which is an IEM). HarmonicDyne Helios is correctly categorized as cans - it's an open-back over-ear headphone with 50mm dynamic driver, weighing 360g. NOTE: If this was intended to be the Symphonium Helios IEM, the brand should be corrected to 'Symphonium' (not 'Symphonium HarmonicDyne') and category changed to 'iems'.

data_enrichment.name: Audeze LCD-XC
data_enrichment.source: Audeze official website / B&H Photo / Moon Audio
data_enrichment.notes: Despite low 20-ohm impedance and high sensitivity (100dB/1mW), benefits from amplification but works with portable devices. Recommended power: >250mW.

data_enrichment.name: Audeze Euclid
data_enrichment.notes: High efficiency at 105-110dB/mW with 12 ohm impedance makes it easy to drive from portable sources. Includes multiple ear tip options.

data_enrichment.name: A&K T8iE
data_enrichment.source: Astell & Kern official / Headfonia / The Absolute Sound
data_enrichment.notes: Dynamic driver with Tesla technology. Sensitivity: 109dB SPL. Easy to drive from portable devices.

data_enrichment.name: Audiosense DT200
data_enrichment.notes: 2 Knowles BA drivers (1 for highs, 1 for mids/lows). Sensitivity: 99±3dB. Fairly easy to drive but scales with better amplification.

data_enrichment.name: Audiosense DT600
data_enrichment.notes: 6 Knowles BA drivers (2 lows, 2 mids, 2 highs). Sensitivity: 106±3dB. Includes 80-ohm impedance adapter for alternate sound signature.

data_enrichment.name: Hifiman HE500
data_enrichment.notes: Sensitivity: 89dB/mW. Despite relatively low impedance, the low sensitivity requires dedicated amplification for optimal performance. Weight: 502g.

data_enrichment.name: Meze Rai Penta
data_enrichment.notes: Penta-hybrid: 4 BA + 1 DD. Sensitivity: 110dB/1mW. Very easy to drive with high sensitivity.

data_enrichment.name: BLON B20
data_enrichment.source: Linsoul / Prime Audio Reviews / Audiophile ON
data_enrichment.notes: Composite planar magnetic 97x76mm drivers. Sensitivity: 96dB. Benefits from dedicated amplification. Weight: 460g.

data_enrichment.name: Final D8000 Pro
data_enrichment.notes: AFDS planar magnetic. Sensitivity: 98dB/mW. Requires amplification for optimal performance. Weight: 523g. Note: D8000 DC Pro variant has 50Ω impedance and 90dB/mW sensitivity.

data_enrichment.name: Moondrop Para
data_enrichment.notes: Ultra-large 100mm planar driver. Sensitivity: 101dB/Vrms (80dB/mW equivalent). Despite low 8Ω impedance, requires high current (up to 1A for 120dB peaks). CRITICAL: Most dongles and basic amps will struggle. Needs desktop amp or powerful DAP with current drive capability.

data_enrichment.name: Moondrop Void
data_enrichment.notes: 50mm dynamic driver. Sensitivity: 110dB/Vrms. Relatively efficient despite 64Ω impedance. Can be driven by USB DAC/amp dongles. Weight: ~250g.

data_enrichment.name: Stax SR-Lambda Pro
data_enrichment.notes: Electrostatic push-pull design with 2μm thick diaphragm. Sensitivity: 108dB/1mW. Bias voltage: 580VDC. REQUIRES dedicated electrostatic amplifier/energizer (not standard headphone amp). Cannot be used with regular headphone outputs. Weight: 15oz.

data_enrichment.name: Symphonium HarmonicDyne Helios
data_enrichment.notes: 50mm German-engineered dynamic driver. Open-back design with walnut wood and stainless steel. Weight: 360g. NOTE: Brand name may be incorrect - should likely be just 'HarmonicDyne' not 'Symphonium HarmonicDyne'. Symphonium Helios is a different product (4BA IEM).

special_notes: Moondrop Para (8Ω) requires high-current amplification despite low impedance
Stax SR-Lambda Pro requires dedicated electrostatic amplifier, not standard headphone amp
Symphonium HarmonicDyne Helios brand name may need verification - likely should be 'HarmonicDyne'
Several planar headphones benefit from dedicated amplification even with moderate impedance
